Location: Hybrid remote in Greater Sudbury, ON
Description:
Demonstrated ability to analyze data and convert it into useful information for decision-making.
Demonstrated ability to research intricate compensation-related…
Descriptions:
Competition: # 2874
Job Title: Compensation Analyst
Department: Compensation & Benefits
Status: Permanent
Work Type: Full-time
Affiliation: Non Union
Shift Assignment: As assigned
Bilingualism Required: No
Police Check Requirement: N/A
Site: Kirkwood Site
Salary Information: $32.23 to $37.92 /hr
Application Closing Date:April 5, 2023
KEY FUNCTION:
Provide professional and analytical support to HSN’s compensation systems (e.g. Union and Non-Union), legislative requirements, contractual obligations, and in support of HSN’s strategic objectives.
REPORTING:
Under the general direction of the Compensation and Benefits Specialist.
DUTIES:
Coordinate and maintain HSN’s Job Evaluation (JE) Systems (e.g. Union and Non-Union) in support of HSN’s Compensation Framework.
Evaluate jobs and ensure the integrity of the job evaluation systems are upheld.
Develop and maintain a JE order of proceedings; document evaluation rationales and communicate results.
Garner job content information in the Job Analysis process through the creation of Job Descriptions (JD) and completion of Job Questionnaires (JQ); liaise with management on the development or revision of job descriptions as required.
Participate on the Job Rating Committees for union and non-union Pay Equity plans in compliance with the Pay Equity Act; ensure the Pay Equity plans are maintained over time.
Maintain statistics on gender predominance for all HSN jobs.
Provide support for Pay Equity complaints and submissions to the Pay Equity Commission.
Research market trends, best practices, analyze compensation survey and internal HSN data; make recommendations to enhance HSN’s compensation systems/processes as required.
Participate in annual and ad hoc salary/compensation surveys; develop quality external market surveys as required and liaise with other hospitals and local organizations to secure participation and ensure integrity of data received.
Review and provide compensation related information for Human Resources Request System (HRRS) tickets (e.g. job postings, new hires, adjustments), job requisitions, management employment contracts and termination letters to ensure adherence to compensation policies; follow up with stakeholders as required.
Provide guidance to management and staff on HSN’s compensation policies and processes.
Verify and audit the integrity of system data to ensure accurate remuneration of employees in compliance with legislation, policies, procedures, and union contracts.
Liaise with internal and external stakeholders, including employees, managers, HR Business Partners, consultants, benefit carriers, and unions.
Draft and review policies, procedures, confidential reports, manuals, letters, standards, and standard of work visuals as required.
Create, run and provide reports to internal stakeholders as required.
Assist in the maintenance, troubleshooting and support of HSN’s Human Capital Management System (HCMS) as required; create file uploads to support departmental and manager changes, general wage increases and benefit premium changes.
Assist in the development of a Compensation Guidebook.
Assist in the development and maintenance of the Compensation and Benefits internal website.
Provide day-to-day coaching, guidance and technical advice to Compensation staff.
Determine and align improvement projects with HSN’s Strategic Plan; monitor and adjust to achieve goal outcomes.
Participate in education and training specific to current, relevant federal and provincial health and safety legislation, standards and guidelines.
Educate and promote health, safety and wellness in the work place.
Represent the department or program on various committees and in meetings as required.
Perform other duties as required.
QUALIFICATIONS
EDUCATION AND TRAINING:
Minimum of a post graduate Diploma in Human Resources Management (HRM), Business Administration, or in a related field, from an accredited college.
Additional specialized training (e.g. Certified Compensation Professional (CCP) designation, Certified Employee Benefits Specialist (CEBS), Certified Human Resources Professional (CHRP), Certified Human Resources Leader (CHRL) designation) is preferred.
Ministry of Labour “Worker Health and Safety Awareness in 4 Steps” training certificate is required.
EXPERIENCE:
Minimum two (2) years of related experience working in a Human Resources (HR) department within a unionized environment, preferably in the public sector.
Experience working with SAP Success Factors is preferred.
KNOWLEDGE/SKILLS/ABILITIES:
Demonstrated knowledge of the Pay Equity Act and its regulations.
Demonstrated knowledge of Compensation Theory and contemporary strategies and alternatives.
Demonstrated ability to interpret legislation and employment law.
Demonstrated ability to analyze data and convert it into useful information for decision-making.
Demonstrated ability to research intricate compensation-related issues with minimal direction.
Demonstrated knowledge of group benefit contracts and programs.
Demonstrated superior attention to detail with a high degree of accuracy.
Demonstrated critical thinking, influencing, and problem-solving skills.
Demonstrated training, experience or utilization of lean methodology for process improvement.
Demonstrated ability to independently identify issues, plan improvements, measure success and continue improvement.
Demonstrated excellent computer skills with proficiency in Microsoft Office software (e.g. Word, Excel, Power Point and Outlook) and patient information systems.
Demonstrated superior interpersonal and communication skills, both written and verbal.
Effective time management and organizational skills with the ability to organize and prioritize as required.
Demonstrated discretion and maturity when handling confidential information.
Demonstrated commitment to the safety of co-workers and patients.
PERSONAL SUITABILITY:
Demonstrated commitment to ongoing professional development.
Demonstrated professionalism in dealing with confidential and sensitive issues.
Demonstrated positive work record and excellent attendance record.
Ability to meet the physical and sensory demands of the job.
Ability to travel between local sites.
OTHER:
Bilingualism is an asset.

Salary: $32.23-$37.92 per hour
Schedule:
Day shift
Monday to Friday

Business Analyst

eHealth

Excellent interpersonal, oral, and written communication skills with the ability manage multiple interactions with multiple groups while working on multiple issues at the same time.

As a strong asset for consideration, we are looking for our successful candidate to have: Knowledge of social, economic, political and historical realities impacting indigenous communities and familiarity with Indigenous Cultural Safety and anti-racism and accompanying reports (BC DRIPA, TRC, etc.)
What we bring

Every PHSA employee enables the best possible patient care for our patients and their families. Whether you are providing direct care, conducting research, or making it possible for others to do their work, you impact the lives of British Columbians today and in the future. That’s why we’re focused on your care too – offering health, wellness, development programs to support you – at work and at home.

Join one of BC’s largest employers with province-wide programs, services and operations – offering vast opportunities for growth, development, and recognition programs that honour the commitment and contribution of all employees.
Access to professional development opportunities through our in-house training programs, including +2,000 courses, such as our San’yas Indigenous Cultural Safety Training course, or Core Linx for Leadership roles.
PHSA is a remote work friendly employer, welcoming flexible work options to support our people (eligibility may vary, depending on position).
Access to WorkPerks, a premium discount program offering a wide range of local and national discounts on electronics, entertainment, dining, travel, wellness, apparel, and more.
Job Type: Temporary Casual
Location: Vancouver BC V5C 6E3
Salary Range: $30.00 - $40.00/hour. As a casual employee, total earnings includes an additional 12.6% in lieu of benefits and paid time off
Hours of Work: Monday to Friday (37.5 hours per week)
Requisition # TOD2142023

As per the current Public Health Order, full vaccination against COVID-19 is a condition of employment with PHSA as of October 26, 2021.

What we do
The Provincial Health Services Authority (PHSA) plans, manages and evaluates specialized health services with the BC health authorities to provide equitable and cost-effective health care for people throughout the province. Our values reflect our commitment to excellence and include: Respect people – Be compassionate – Dare to innovate – Cultivate partnerships – Serve with purpose.

Learn more about PHSA and our programs: jobs.phsa.ca/programs-and-services

PHSA is committed to employment equity, encouraging all qualified individuals to apply. We recognize that our ability to provide the best care for our diverse patient populations relies on a rich diversity of skills, knowledge, background and experience, and value a safe, inclusive and welcoming environment.

Reconciliation is an ongoing process and a shared responsibility for all of us. The BC Governments’ unanimous passage of the Declaration on the Rights of Indigenous Peoples Act was a significant step forward in this journey—one that all health authorities are expected to support as we work in cooperation with Indigenous Peoples to establish a clear and sustainable path to lasting reconciliation. True reconciliation will take time and ongoing commitment to work with Indigenous Peoples as they move toward self-determination. Guiding these efforts Crown agencies must remain focused on creating opportunities that implement the Truth and Reconciliation Commission Mandate.

This position is part of PHSA Talent on Demand – an in-house recruitment service providing talent to PHSA and other health authorities. We manage a robust talent pool of service-minded professionals who are available to start work immediately. Talent on Demand creates a gateway for those who wish to achieve their career goals. Successful candidates will gain significant health care experience and can transition into long-term, permanent roles within PHSA. For more information, visit talentondemand@phsa.ca.

COMPANY PROFILE:
Red River Mutual is a progressive insurance company with a focus on our customers and employees. We believe everyone has a right to feel safe and protected, and to know that someone is looking out for them. So we treat our employees like family members – we’ll be honest with them, support them, offer a listening ear, admit when we’re wrong and be a positive force in their lives and in our communities.

SCHEDULE: Contract
REPORTS TO: VP, Data and Analytics
DIRECT REPORTS: N/A

PURPOSE OF POSITION:
The Power BI developer is responsible for supporting the data and analytics operations. They will assist in improving the department's reporting capability by providing insights and recommendations, supporting the roll out of all reporting through our Power BI-driven Insight Hub. Additionally, they will support the team through testing and documenting the Power BI solutions they develop. This is a term position, that may vary based on project needs, with the potential to transition to permanent.

KEY RESPONSIBILITY AREAS:
Conceptualize, design, and implement Power BI solutions from the existing data warehouse, and other enterprise data sources.
Creates mock-up reports for proof-of-concept reviews focused on easy to digest storytelling formats
Utilize Power BI to build interactive and visually appealing reports and dashboards for deployment in Web-based environments in accordance with predefined detailed report specifications.
Assist in testing to ensure data integrity, data quality, and program functional completeness & correctness.
Assist in production of technical documentation for colleagues, as well as procedures for end users.
Ensures data security and prevents unauthorized parties from gaining access to the data.
QUALIFICATION AND SKILLS:

College or University degree in Computer Science, Business Intelligence, Data Science, Commerce, Business Administration, or a related discipline, preferred
1+ years of experience in a Power BI Developer, or similar data-related role, developing sophisticated solutions and uncovering actionable insights.
Experience with DAX, M and SQL languages.
Experience with MS Power BI Dataflows.
Ability to create reports/dashboards with large data sets for Business Intelligence needs.
Ability to prioritize, manage information and problem solve.
Strong ability to work on multiple initiatives simultaneously and work within tight deadlines
Excellent attention to detail
Strong written and oral communication skills

Looking to unbox your full potential? STEP UP with the ALDO GROUP.
WE'RE ON A JOURNEY TO CREATE A WORLD OF LOVE, CONFIDENCE AND BELONGING
The ALDO Group has been on this journey for over 40 years. We believe that our passionate associates are at the heart of our success, and that with them we will lead into our future with kindness.
The ALDO Group is committed to diversity and inclusion, not only now, but for the long term. We strongly encourage people who are Aboriginal, racialized, have disabilities, come from gender and sexually diverse communities and/or have intersectional identities to apply for employment with us. At ALDO Group, we will always strive to take steps to create a diverse and inclusive work environment that promotes equal opportunity and accountability.#WeAreALDO

To be part of a company that takes a stand on issues affecting people, the environment, and our partners

Attractive total compensation!
YOUR ROLE
The compensation analyst participates in the development and implementation of total compensation policies and programs. The incumbent will particularly be responsible for ensuring that our total compensation package is competitive across all our markets. He/She will therefore play an active role in all activities related to the compensation of our associates.

Responsibilities

Compensation

Follow all market trends.

Human Resources Information System (HRIS)

Salary structures
Performance evaluation et annual salary review
Calculation of bonuses
Other conditions, such as vacations, allocations, etc.
Maintain data integrity within the system (conduct continuous audits and make necessary changes).
Help with the maintenance and testing of new system features.

Group Insurance
In collaboration with the team of business partners, managers and employees, ensure the proper management of disabilities by overseeing the services offered to our employees while they are on leave, as well as by establishing the optimal conditions for their return to work.

Minimum of 1 to 2 years of experience in a similar role
Bachelor’s degree in HR or in a related quantitative field
Experience handling and analyzing data
Attention to detail

Team player (work remotely, in person, in groups, etc.)
Experience in the retail industry, an asset

Title: Senior Data Analyst
Description:
Explore data to build foundational data knowledge in the subject domain, in partnership with data owners.
Enhance existing or create new products and services…
Descriptions:
Who We Are
Teranet is Canada’s leader in the delivery and transformation of statutory registry services with extensive expertise in land and commercial registries. We also market insightful property and data solutions, as well as practice management automation to thousands of customers in the real estate, financial services, government, utilities, and legal markets. Founded in 1991, Teranet operates the Electronic Registration System for the Province of Ontario, Teranet Manitoba—a service provider to the Manitoba government, and Collateral Management Solutions—the market leader in Canadian lien registration and search, asset recovery services, and insolvency management. Most recently, Teranet expanded its global footprint by acquiring Foster Moore. This acquisition expands its registry solutions to include Catalyst™; a commercial off-the-shelf registry software that delivers operational cost reductions enhanced security and process improvements. Teranet is owned by OMERS Infrastructure, a leading global infrastructure investment manager and the infrastructure arm of the Ontario Municipal Employee Retirement System.
Connect. Grow. Thrive Together.
To learn more about who we are visit our website:
www.teranet.ca
Why Teranet
We may be a global innovator in electronic services and solutions who operate one of the most advanced and secure registration systems in the world, but we’re so much more than that!
Our Extraordinary People.
Together, we are passionate, driven, resourceful, and authentic.
Growth Opportunities.
We not only encourage a culture of openly talking about our career aspirations but one where we truly invest in the continuous learning, development, and growth of our people.
Our Work Environment.
We believe in cultivating a work environment that makes our people feel comfortable, engaged, appreciated, and happy.
Company Culture & Core Values
Our company culture and core values are the core of our identity. They define who we are, how we engage with each other and our clients, and how we conduct business every day.
About the Role
The Data & Analytics team within the Financial Solutions line of business has an ambitious mandate, where we are accountable for leveraging Data & Analytics to deliver business value both internally as well as to external clients through the following:
Enhance existing or create new products and services with proprietary data assets and partnering with external data providers, through the application of data science
Design and deliver custom data solutions to fulfill specific client needs
Explore and analyze data to generate business insights to enhance decision-making
Demonstrate thought leadership in the ecosystem in which we operate
Identify and implement opportunities for operational efficiencies across the organization
In addition, this team will play an important role in evangelizing and educating about the value of Data & Analytics to the rest of the organization, in support of cultivating a data-driven culture.
The Senior Data Analyst will play key roles across all of these critical activities to help the team achieve its goals.
What you will be doing
The Senior Data Analyst is accountable for the entire lifecycle of each assigned analytics use case, from user requirements all the way to delivery/production.
Data analysis, modeling, and storytelling (70%)
Engage with stakeholders (including external clients) to understand business requirements and objectives for data & analytics use cases
For each use case, own the end-to-end data pipeline development from data ingestion through to operationalization:
Identify and acquire the best data sources available to meet analytics objectives. Explore data to build foundational data knowledge in the subject domain, in partnership with data owners
Develop data models to meet the requirements of each analytics use case. Partner with Data Engineers and Data Architect to implement the data models in the Big Data Platform
Deploy and operationalize data views to business end users
Present technical analyses and business insights in a meaningful and intuitive manner, in accordance with the target audience
For each use case, thorough documentation of the objectives, analysis process, methods, and findings to meet quality standards and production requirements
Actively partner with the Data Governance team to ensure that the use of data for each use case complies with Teranet policies and procedures
Actively evaluate existing data product/service to identify new tools, partners, or data that can enhance its performance
Mentoring and coaching junior team members (20%)
Delegate analysis and/or visualization tasks to more junior members of the team in support of the delivery of analytics use cases
Provide direction for and review the assigned work
Provide learning and growth opportunities to support the professional development of other team members
Contribute to developing Teranet Data & Analytics team to be best-in-class (10%)
Be attuned to the latest developments in Data & Analytics, and share learnings and ideas with team to cultivate a spirit of innovation
As a team, develop framework to standardize analysis processes, methodologies, and documentation
Provide feedback and suggestions to enhance and evolve our Analytics program to better meet our corporate goals
Evangelize the value of Data & Analytics at Teranet through engagement with the rest of the organization
About you
Technical qualifications:
Bachelor’s degree in a quantitative field: Statistics, Mathematics, Computer Science, Engineering
Minimum 5 years of work experience in a Data Analyst capacity
Proficiency in SQL, Python (regular usage, practical experience)
Working knowledge of R
Deep experience in data analysis: data cleaning, exploration, and modeling
Practical experience in developing predictive and prescriptive models (Machine Learning)
Proficiency in using data visualization tools (Tableau) and other BI tools (PowerBI)
Practical experience working with Big Data Technologies: Hadoop, HDFS, Hive, HBase, Storm, Spark, Kafka, etc.
Interpersonal skills:
Strong organization skills and discipline
Ability to balance multiple deliverables and manage projects to targeted milestones
Self-starter with ambition and enthusiasm
Agile and flexible to accommodate evolving deliverables in a challenging and ambiguous environment
Actively build relationships and collaborate with stakeholders to further learning and develop meaningful solutions
What We Offer
Competitive and comprehensive Total Rewards Package
Paid Vacation & Sick Leaves
Maternity, Parental, and/or Adoption Leave Top-Up Program
100% Employer-Paid Health Benefit Plan
Retirement Savings Plans with Employer Matching Scheme
Ongoing Financial Wellness Seminars
Corporate Discounted Programs + Wellness Program
Employee Assistance Program (EAP) for our employees and their families!
What’s It Like At Teranet
We operate through our core values
We have received numerous awards for our technologies and our successful partnership with the Government of Ontario.
We have been recognized as one of Greater Toronto’s Top Employers for 4 consecutive years.
We have a rich history, and we are pleased to make you a part of our exciting future
At Teranet, we are committed to fostering an inclusive, accessible environment, where all employees and customers feel valued, respected, and supported. We are dedicated to building a workforce that reflects the diversity of our customers and the communities in which we live and serve. If you require accommodation during the recruitment and selection process, please let us know and we will work with you to meet your needs.
Come As You Are. We Like You that Way!

Title: Analytics Business Analyst
Description:
4+ years of related work experience with data analytics.
Understanding the fundamentals of data analytics, RPA, and Application integration.
Descriptions:
Analytics Business Analyst
Where Greatness Grows
The greatest achievements in history are borne from the greatness within people – where human potential meets vision, and passion fuels evolution. Unlocking this potential is the most important thing we do at Bird.
As a leader in Canadian construction for over 100 years, the impact of our team is etched deeply within the core of our legacy. Beyond Bird, this impact is felt in the fundamental aspects of our everyday lives. From the critical infrastructure we depend on, to the energy and resources that keep us moving - we are powering our communities and shaping Canada’s skylines coast-to-coast. Entrenched in the foundation of a culture built more than a century ago is an enduring quest to reimagine what is possible. Our impact is greater than ever, and we are looking for those who seek to redefine their story.
We are a dynamic team of over 5,000 with a range of professions, backgrounds, and areas of expertise. This breadth of diversity in people and opportunities is one of greatest aspects of building your career with Bird. Every trajectory looks different. At Bird, you hold the pen, and you write your story. As you unlock your potential, you are surrounded by a team that supports you every step of the way.
Be a part of our team, where we pride ourselves on the quality of our work and the way we treat each other and our partners. You will build a career and long-lasting relationships based on respect, collaboration, and a solution-focused mindset. Bird is a place where you will unlock your potential and achieve your goals.
Reporting to the Manager, Business Intelligence & Analytics, the Analytics Business Analyst is responsible for producing, analyzing, specifying, and validating the business data requirements of stakeholders and end users. This includes interviewing stakeholders and gathering and compiling user requirements to understand the Business Intelligence, Application Integration and Robotic Process automation solutions.

The ideal candidate will understand translating conceptual user requirements into functional requirements in a clear manner that is comprehensible to Data Analyst, RPA, and application-to-application developers.

The Analytics Business Analyst will apply proven communication, analytical, and problem-solving skills to help the business make good technology decisions. The Analytics, Business Analyst will also be proactive about working with the Emerging Technology partners to look for new solutions using technology to optimize business processes.

This position is based in the Calgary, AB office, however open to other locations across Canada.
Responsibilities
Strategy and Planning
Collaborate with project sponsors to determine analytics project scope and vision.
Clearly identify project stakeholders managing expectations by developing a communication process to keep them up to date on project results.
Conduct interviews to gather user requirements via workshops, questionnaires, surveys, site visits, workflow storyboards, use cases, scenarios, and other methods.
Identify and establish scope and parameters of requirements analysis on a project-by-project basis to define project impact, outcome criteria, and metrics.
Work with stakeholders and project team to prioritize collected requirements.
Research, review, and analyze the effectiveness and efficiency of existing requirements-gathering processes and develop strategies for enhancing or further leveraging these processes.
Operational Management
Analyze and verify requirements for completeness, consistency, comprehensibility, feasibility, and conformity to standards.
Develop and utilize standard templates to accurately and concisely write requirements specifications.
Where applicable, develop prototypes of interfaces and attributes based on user requirements.
Create process models, specifications, diagrams, and charts to provide direction to developers and/or the project team.
Develop and conduct peer reviews of business requirements to ensure that requirement specifications are correctly interpreted.
Assist with the interpretation of user requirements into feasible options and communicate these back to the business stakeholders.
Manage and track the status of requirements throughout the project lifecycle; enforce and redefine as necessary.
Communicate changes, enhancements, and modifications of business requirements – verbally or through written documentation – to project managers, sponsors, and other stakeholders so that issues and solutions are understood.
Provide guidance and/or instruction to junior staff members.
What We Are Looking For
Undergraduate degree or diploma in Computer science, Finance, Business Administration, Information Systems, or relevant experience
4+ years of related work experience with data analytics
Experience overseeing the design, development, and implementation of Data and Application Integration projects, desired experience with RPA solutions
Ability to create systematic and consistent requirements specifications in both technical and user-friendly language
Exceptional analytical and statistical skills with the ability to apply them to systems issues and products as required
Demonstrated project management skills and project management software skills, including planning, organizing, and managing resources
Understanding the fundamentals of data analytics, RPA, and Application integration
Data analysis – Proficiency with SQL, Power BI and Microsoft Excel
Ability to forge, grow and maintain positive relationships with multiple groups
Ability to manage multiple priorities simultaneously and meet the time demands of unpredictable activities, capable of handling pressure and challenges in a dynamic business environment
Ability to work within tight deadlines and prioritization of work to achieve them
Strong analytical, critical thinking, problem-solving skills, and a high degree of accuracy and attention to detail
Highly developed interpersonal, communication, and organizational skills
Demonstrated sense of urgency and strong commitment to achieving goals; ability to work in challenging, fast paced and steadily changing environment
Ability to work collaboratively with a positive attitude
Highly developed written and verbal communication skills
We Put Safety First
A healthy and safe work environment is non-negotiable. We build a culture of operational and psychological safety through engagement, learning and leadership.
We Lead With Honesty
We speak and act with integrity, clarity and care so people can trust our word and our work. Being honest means we can deliver the best outcomes and consistent results.
We Are Stronger Together
Success is a team effort. Our inclusive workplace enables our combined expertise, humility and creativity to unlock our greater potential.
We Are Driven To Do Great Work
We built our name on quality. We have a passion for excellence in our work and relationships that honours our businesses and our industry.
We Create Opportunity
Rooted in a solid foundation, we adapt and grow to face the future. We are committed to elevating each other to chart the best path forward in an evolving world.

Title: IT Business Analyst
Description: On this basis, we are looking for a motivated IT business analyst assist in bringing change to the organization through the analysis, research, and…
Descriptions:
About us
ANDY prides itself on providing the highest standard of tailor-made services, including the transport of goods, logistics, warehousing, and fleet management solutions, with a combination of European and North American experience and expertise in the field. We are known to transform clients and operations needs into business opportunities, integrating services that add value and simplify customers' experience. As one of the largest woman-owned asset-based transportation companies in North America, we grew organically from one business unit of 60 employees in 2012 to four business units of 500 employees in 2022. We are now in a better position than ever to continue our expansion.
About the role
On this basis, we are looking for a motivated IT business analyst assist in bringing change to the organization through the analysis, research, and implementation of new software and technology in an outsourced software environment. Create solutions based on the requirements identified, and work towards achieving the organization's long-term goals.
What you'll do here:
Conduct interviews to gain an understanding of the work being done, and the methods used within the organization.
Map current workflows and assist in the development of improved business workflows using automation.
Document business processes and create process diagrams to communicate the processes.
Gather, organize, and communicate the software requirements within the organization.
Determine the solutions to issues, and constraints imposed by the business, or other systems.
Analyze the needs, and requirement to help the business to meet its objectives and goals.
Assist in the creation of business cases to propose solutions to possible issues and justify investments in new software solutions.
Understand business requirements from multiple stakeholders and prioritize them.
Facilitate the deployment of new software solutions within the organization.
Create training materials for system users.
Assist in the development and expansion of Data Warehouse capabilities.
What you bring to the table:
Strong planning, organizational and analytical skills
Excellent verbal and written communication skills (English)
Communication and teaching skills
Able to manage multiple company responsibilities.
Understanding of relational database concepts
Knowledge of change management principles
Experience with business software solutions such as; Financial Accounting, CRM, ERP, WMS, TMS.
University degree or equivalent education and experience
Industry experience in Transportation & logistics (an asset)
Here are a few reasons why others have joined our team:
An award-winning, inspiring workplace that supports its people and recognizes great work
Stimulating, challenging projects and development opportunities to help you grow your skills and career
A comprehensive financial rewards program that recognizes your success
An extensive, flexible benefits package.
What we offer
Working here means you'll be empowered to be and do your best every day. Here is some of what you can expect as a permanent member of our team:
A competitive salary
Flexible work arrangements
Company vehicle provided.
An extensive flex pension and benefits package, with access to virtual healthcare
An annual wellness account that promotes an active and healthy lifestyle
Access to tools and resources to support physical and mental health, embracing change and connecting with colleagues
A dynamic workplace learning ecosystem complete with learning journeys, interactive online content, and inspiring programs
Inclusive employee-led networks to educate, inspire, amplify voices, build relationships and provide development opportunities
Inspiring leaders and colleagues who will lift you up and help you grow
A Community Impact program, because what you care about is a part of what makes you different. And how you contribute to your community should be just as unique
We are an equal opportunity employer
At Andy, we value diversity and strive to create an inclusive, accessible workplace where all individuals feel valued, respected, and heard.

Title: Costing and Data Analyst
Description:
Analyze data to verify standard costs against actual costs.
Background in cost accounting and data analytics with a minimum of 3-4 year of experience;
Descriptions:
Maritime Paper is a dynamic and team-oriented company. We believe that hiring the best people results in superior packaging and stronger relationships with our customers. Our company was founded in 1931 and we have facilities in Dartmouth, NS, Moncton, NB, Mount Pearl, NL and Summerside, PE. We are honored to be a member of Canada Best Managed Companies.
We are currently seeking a Costing and Data Analyst based out of our Dartmouth, NS location. This is a permanent full-time role. Reporting to the Chief Financial Officer, the primary responsibilities of this role are:
Gather and analyze data to update, maintain and optimize the cost accounting standards and cost system.
Audit and revise machine and cost standards to ensure accurate management reporting.
Analyze data to verify standard costs against actual costs. Investigate outliers and variances between standard and actual costs with recommendations on corrective action.
Updating of product cost tables and ensure accuracy of estimating for new and proposed product costs. Participate in tender processes as required.
Evaluate pricing and margins on all segments of our business and assist Sales Department in determining fair and optimal pricing levels.
Work with Sales Management and Finance team to develop customer volume and margin reports to help direct sales efforts in a strategically focused way.
Work with our information systems to develop and enhance reporting and process related to management and cost accounting.
Provide support for Pricing Department, as required.
Participate in inventory management including physical counts, inventory administration and inventory management strategy.
Assist in other process as required including month-end and year-end closing, accounting procedures and processes and day-to-day accounting functions.
The successful candidate will have the following qualifications:
As the ideal candidate, you have a business degree in finance or accounting, and 3+ years experience in a similar role. A CPA designation would be an asset;
Background in cost accounting and data analytics with a minimum of 3-4 year of experience;
Strong MS Excel skills including knowledge of formulas and functions to gather, analyze, manipulate and audit large data sets;
SQL skills with the ability to perform effective querying involving multiple tables and subqueries;
Knowledge of purchasing, receiving and inventory flow;
Excellent interpersonal and communication skills;
Exceptional analytical and problem-solving skills;
Self-motivated and able to work independently or as a part of a team;
Desire for continuous learning; eager to understand other areas of the business (ie. operational aspects).
Strong work ethic and positive attitude.
Our company offers the following employee benefits and incentives:
Group Insurance Program
Employee and family assistance program

Defined contribution pension plan
Safety milestone celebrations

Yearly fitness incentive
On-site fitness room

Perfect attendance and service awards
On-site Health programs

Scholarship program
Employee celebrations and events

Applications can be submitted through our careers link at www.maritimepaper.com.
Maritime Paper Products is committed to creating a diverse environment and is proud to be an equal opportunity employer.
We are committed to inclusive, barrier-free recruitment and selection processes and work environments. Any information received relating to accommodation will be addressed confidentially.
Although we gratefully accept all applications, only those candidates being considered for an interview will be contacted.
No telephone calls please.
An Equal Opportunity Employer

Title: Senior Risk Analyst, Enterprise Risk Governance, ERM
Description:
Demonstrates ability to analyze data, draw conclusions and visualize results.
Support for the annual RAS Scorecard, and Risk and Control Event data…
Descriptions:
TD Description
Tell us your story. Don't go unnoticed. Explain why you're a winning candidate. Think "TD" if you crave meaningful work and embrace change like we do. We are a trusted North American leader that cares about people and inspires them to grow and move forward.
Stay current and competitive. Carve out a career for yourself. Grow with us.
Department Overview
Enterprise Risk Management (ERM) is responsible for building organizational capability in managing risk on a more integrated and comprehensive basis for the organization and for promoting a strong risk culture within TD. The team is accountable for the development and implementation of an enterprise risk management strategy, governance, policies and practices, reporting and operating frameworks, and operations associated with the Risk Management function.

TD applies the “Three Lines of Defence” model to risk management as defined in the Enterprise Risk Framework. As part of the second line of defense, the ERM team assures the appropriate design, implementation, and/or execution of (applicable components of) the TD risk management framework.

ERM collaborates with a broad network of business and risk management practitioners and other corporate functions in all jurisdictions where the Bank has business activities.
Job Description
Reporting to the Senior Manager, Enterprise Risk Governance (ERG) – Reporting. Key accountabilities of the position is the production of clear, impactful, timely risk reporting. In this role, the vast majority of reports produced are presented to Senior Management, the CRO and the Board. The successful candidate will be a strong communicator, with both written and visual presentation skills, and with a demonstrated ability to work across the organization on high profile deliverables, including:
Leading the production process of the TD Risk Dashboard by consolidating the submitted information from the dashboard teams across multiple corporate and/or business segments and providing an effective challenge on the submitted ratings, commentary and key issues identified by applying risk management knowledge.
Updating and maintaining documentation associated with the dashboard, including process maps, standards and guidelines.
Maintenance and oversight of the Risk Appetite Reporting & Monitoring Tool, which acts as the book of record for Risk Appetite measure results. This includes troubleshooting system issues, updating system templates and system access as required, acting as the main point of contact for system users and following for excess escalation documentation.
Working closely with the business segments and corporate partners to ensure risk profile reporting is compliant with the relevant regulatory expectations and framework or standards by providing guidance and implementation oversight.
Support the evolution and maturity of risk dashboard reporting, including creation, development and support of consolidated reporting databases using Excel, Power Platform or other database management tools. Identify and embrace automation opportunities and work to build out improved processes and roll them out to stakeholders.
Support and assist with the annual Risk Appetite Statement (RAS) update and associated processes. This includes the coordination, analysis and challenge of RAS updates, quality assurance of the RAS content, production of materials for tabled and presented items to the Risk Committee of the Board, the Enterprise Risk Management Committee, and executive review meetings. Support for the annual RAS Scorecard, and Risk and Control Event data consolidation process is also required.
Regulatory / Audit Requests: Act as the central point of contact for managing and coordinating regulatory and audit related requests for the team as assigned.
Other accountabilities as assigned by senior management, assist with data analysis and presentations, support other key governance initiatives and processes within the Enterprise Risk Governance Group
The candidate will work collaboratively with all business partners to provide effective support and manage additional responsibilities as outlined above.

This position will appeal to an individual who is comfortable working in a fast-paced environment, has good analysis and communication skills, is prepared to take on new challenges, can deliver a high level of quality standard, and can work well independently and with the broader team. The successful candidate will gain an enterprise-wide perspective of TD and exposure to numerous risk management, business and corporate function groups.
Job Requirements
3+ years' experience in a control function (Risk Management / Audit / Compliance) preferred
Experience with reporting, committee / meeting governance and procedures an asset
Strong organizational skills and attention to detail
Strong MS skills (Word, Excel, PowerPoint, Access, Power Platform)
Demonstrates strong written and verbal communication skills
Demonstrates ability to analyze data, draw conclusions and visualize results
Ability to connect-the-dots to engage the right partners
Enjoys working in a team environment but also able to work independently
Ability to understand and interpret regulations and policies
Demonstrated project/process management skills, including developing and tracking to established timelines
Good awareness of the organization, and business products and services is desired
Ability to use influencing skills to implement changes and build consensus an asset
Inclusiveness
At TD, we are committed to fostering an inclusive, accessible environment, where all employees and customers feel valued, respected and supported. We are dedicated to building a workforce that reflects the diversity of our customers and communities in which we live and serve. If you require an accommodation for the recruitment/interview process (including alternate formats of materials, or accessible meeting rooms or other accommodation), please let us know and we will work with you to meet your needs.

Title: Business Intelligence Analyst
Description:
Assume accountability for business value creation by the defined BI / data product(s) within one or more data domains.
Bilingual in English and French.
Descriptions:

28592_092022

Permanent - Full time

Description :
Would you like to be an active stakeholder in a major modernization project? VIA Rail is about to change all its reservation platform for all its systems throughout Canada and is looking for a Business Intelligence Analyst who would like to play an important role in an autonomous, efficient, and competent team.

As a Business Intelligence Analyst, you will be responsible for creating value and insight for our internal and external customers by leveraging data to drive business transformation and business outcomes. Daily, you will be participating in a creative and agile multidisciplinary team to resolve business or technical challenges and building a data-driven culture by owning, shaping, and evolving BI / Analytics / Data at VIA within the Evolution team as well as on BI projects.

In your role, you will have to turn data into information by leveraging business acumen, coupled with knowledge of business intelligence, analytics, and AI solutions (ex. machine learning), as capabilities and the possible applications of these. You will be at the heart of VIA Rail’s Business Transformation Office (BTO) and setting the standard for the Business intelligence (BI) practice!

If you can talk to developers and businesspeople with equal ease, to turn data into information and ultimately into business outcomes, you are the Business Intelligence Analyst we are looking for!

What are the responsibilities of a Business Intelligence Analyst?
Liaise with the Business and the Subject Matter Experts (SMEs) to drive requirements gathering, define scope, priorities and share plans.
Assume accountability for business value creation by the defined BI / data product(s) within one or more data domains.
Design and create insightful reports and visuals by integrating story telling techniques.
Provide coaching and support to internal BI contributors to develop autonomy and raise BI maturity level.
Work with the architecture team, the solution analysts, the security team, and the business, explore system improvements and future innovation, define and grow data governance practices and data management practices at VIA.
Manage the release / implementation / support plans and commitments in line with sprints and users. Support users during the deployment of the solution.
Participate in the development of documentation, peer reviews, acceptance tests, facilitative tools and training programs intended for users.
Requirements :
What experience are we looking for?
Bachelor’s Degree in Information Technology or Computer Science (or a related field).
Masters in BI or equivalent (a definite asset)
5+years of experience in writing user stories / use cases, data modeling, and developing functional specifications or equivalent experience.
5+ years of experience working with Microsoft Azure BI solutions (Data Factory, Power BI, Data Lake, etc), SSIS / SSRS or other equivalent technologies.
Notions or experience with the following methodologies: star schema / dimensional modeling (Kimball)
Knowledge of scripted language (SQL) and relational database management skills.

Which competencies should you have as a Business Intelligence Analyst for this project?
Developed analytical skills, ability to resolve problems and attention to details.
Ability to work in a hybrid Agile and Waterfall environment
Familiar with ETL / ELT data extraction approaches
Bilingual in English and French
Statistics or mathematics knowledge (is an asset)
Good information dashboard design (BI “story telling” : making the numbers talk and trigger constructive discussions)
Knowledge or experience of Machine Learning and other IA concepts (is an asset)
Microsoft and collaboration tools knowledge: O365, Teams, Azure DevOps, JIRA, EPM, etc.
Excellent communication skills: capacity to adopt internal partners’ perspectives, provides constructive feedback, have frank discussions, to explains concepts in a clear and logical manner.
Team player that can work collaboratively with members of various teams
Capacity to prioritize the work to be done in order to maximize available resources / outcome (use of an iterative approach prioritizing based on user value).

Why choose VIA Rail?
Employer of choice number 1 in Transportation in Canada (come discover why!)
Generous compensation and benefits package
Flexible options for hybrid remote work
A close knit team of autonomous and competent co workers
Numerous opportunities for career advancement
An environment that supports employee health and well being
A wide range of health and wellness benefits for employees and their families, including unlimited telemedicine service
To contribute to a sustainable transportation service connecting Canadian communities
Learn more about VIA Rail: https://corpo.viarail.ca/en/company

Join our 3,200 other employees in helping provide Canadians with a safe, accessible, environmentally sustainable way to travel by setting the standard for the Business intelligence (BI) practice!

Condition of Employment:
VIA Rail is committed to protecting the health and providing a safe environment for its employees and customers. VIA Rail has currently suspended its vaccination policy which requires that all members of its staff be fully vaccinated against COVID-19 and provide proof as a condition of employment. Please note, that if the policy is reinstated in the future, employees will be required to comply.



VIA Rail thanks all applicants for their interest, however only those selected for an interview will be contacted. VIA Rail is an employment-equity employer and encourages all qualified candidates to apply. VIA Rail Canada is proud to be a military friendly employer.

Title: Business Systems Analyst
Description:
Familiar with concepts of data modelling and system configuration.
The Business Process Management (BPM) portfolio team under BCS Technology group of RBC…
Descriptions:
Come Work with Us!

At RBC, our culture is deeply supportive and rich in opportunity and reward. You will help our clients thrive and our communities prosper, empowered by a spirit of shared purpose.

Whether you’re helping clients find new opportunities, developing new technology, or providing expert advice to internal partners, you will be doing work that matters in the world, in an environment built on teamwork, service, responsibility, diversity, and integrity.
Job Title
Business Systems Analyst
Job Description
WHAT IS THE OPPORTUNITY?
The Business Process Management (BPM) portfolio team under BCS Technology group of RBC Capital Markets is responsible to manage existing solutions and build new business focused solutions that improve operational efficiency, enable process automation and improve audit and compliance. As a Business System Analyst, you will be responsible for overall business requirements, documentation, business stakeholder management, applications demos/walk through, app validations, and coordinate with other teams for the CR processes and deployments. In this role you will as well be responsible for managing medium size initiatives to ensure objectives are accomplished within committed targets. The portfolio offers a fast paced environment with solutions serving different business functions which offers many opportunities to learn and grow in the role
WHAT WILL YOU DO?
Understand existing application flows, system architecture, upstream/downstream integrations & business rules and build / update required documents
Act as liaison between multiple business stakeholder groups to understand, challenge and capture the business requirements
Ability to translate business requirements to technical specifications and work close with the development team to refine the requirements
Own requirements capture, documentation, requirement and app reviews and coordination of sign-offs by various Business and IT teams
Coordinate with project team for delivery, requirements clarifications, analysis, impact assessment and create required documentation – user stories, workflow diagrams, mockups, system specifications, RAID logs, traceability matrix, non-functional requirements, user manuals, support document, etc.
Own release planning and coordination activities which can include but not limited to reviews, setup requests and change management process, approvals, etc.
Support PM for managing medium size initiatives for tracking, delivery, project reporting and identifying and managing issues and risks for successful delivery within committed budgets
Independently manage business and IT stakeholders, drive project meetings. Be hands on with application functionality and perform validation of delivery to business for ensuring scope elements are delivered as per the plan
Contribute to ongoing administrative program, reporting, estimation and other activities as required
WHAT DO YOU NEED TO SUCCEED?
Must have:
Must have working experience in capital markets
Must have working experience in agile and proficient in sprint planning and delivery
Undergraduate degree with 5+ years’ of experience working as a BA/BSA on concurrent initiatives in a fast paced, collaborative environment
Must have excellent written, oral and presentation skills, analytical skills, problem solving and reporting skills. Ability to determine the information and communication needs of the stakeholders and the project and having a self-drive and disciple to execute the same on time
Must be able to effectively challenge business stakeholders in order to obtain clear and concise requirements
Strong organizational, project management and time management capabilities.
A good understanding financial services industry with ability to understand new business processes and technology quickly
Deadline-driven and results-oriented; able to meet consistently high quality standards while handling a variety of tasks and deadlines simultaneously.
Tools: HP ALM, Jira, Confluence Page, SharePoint, MS Office ( Word, Excel, PowerPoint, Visio), MS SQL
RBC is committed to supporting flexible work arrangements when and where available. Details to be discussed with Hiring Manager.
Nice-to-have:
Strategic thinker with excellent interpersonal skills to work across functions and businesses
Development experience building business solutions or application migrations
Experience with relational database (Sybase, Oracle, SQL server etc.) and SQL programming language
Familiar with concepts of data modelling and system configuration. Be able to read and understand xml standards
What’s in it for you?
We thrive on the challenge to be our best, progressive thinking to keep growing, and working together to deliver trusted advice to help our clients thrive and communities prosper. We care about each other, reaching our potential, making a difference to our communities, and achieving success that is mutual.
A comprehensive Total Rewards Program including bonuses and flexible benefits, competitive compensation, commissions, and stock where applicable
Leaders who support your development through coaching and managing opportunities
Ability to make a difference and lasting impact
Work in a dynamic, collaborative, progressive, and high-performing team
A world-class training program in financial services
Flexible work/life balance options
Opportunities to do challenging work

Title: IT Business Data Lead Analyst - Hybrid
Description:
Work with technology to implement data diagnosis and improve data quality metrics.
Work with report owner and report production team to monitor Data Quality…
Descriptions:
The IT Business Data Lead Analyst within the FRMT (Financial Resource Management Technology) Data Services team is responsible for liaising between business users, technologists & Data Governance teams to exchange information in a concise, logical and understandable way in coordination with the Technology team. This role will partner closely with the Federated Functional and Business CDO organizations to track and identify opportunities to improve data quality, sourcing and consumption for Liquidity, Collateral & Capital data sets from strategic sources.
This role sits in FRMT (Financial Resource Management Technology) organization in GFT under the Data Services team that focuses on the Data Acquisition, Distribution and Data Governance for Citi’s Liquidity & Collateral data catering to ICG Markets, Risk, Global Liquidity Management (GLM) & other Liquidity users.

Responsibilities:
Perform detail gap analysis and collaborate with technical resources on solution proposals.
Partner with the front office business, product control, regulatory, Finance & Accounting Policy and Technical/Architecture teams to improve cross functional workflows, PP feeds, and reporting
Collaborate with Technology teams to define requirements and ensure proper governance over applications development, testing, and releases
Reviewing the usage and requirements for Regulatory Reporting Critical Data Element’s (CDE’s)
Driving improvement of CDE data quality for key regulatory reports (FR 2052a, NSFR, PRA110 etc.) with a focus on various financial products (securities, deposits, loans, derivatives, SFTs, debt, etc.) and balances (including P&L, spot and average balances) used in above mentioned regulatory reports.
Manage and improve CDE data quality and CDE requirement review processes
Analyze key reporting production process documentation to identify data elements used by above mentioned key regulatory reports.
Work with stakeholders (report owner, report producer and other key SMEs supporting reporting production) to document and maintain risk based Critical Data Elements used Review existing data quality controls and design fit-for-purpose data quality requirements.
Work with technology to implement data diagnosis and improve data quality metrics.
Work with report owner and report production team to monitor Data Quality Exceptions to identify real data concerns/issues as well as corresponding reporting impact and document accordingly Support Consent Order data related tasks (such as data lineage, reporting data requirement), working with Controller Data Team and Enterprise Chief Data Office.
Solve the highest-impact, highest-profile problems with significant business impact through in-depth evaluation of complex business processes, system processes and industry standards
Influence and negotiate with senior leaders (across functions) and communicate with external parties as needed
Provide user training, solicit feedback, and drive systems adoption
Respond to ad-hoc data requests and provide reporting as needed
Qualifications:
6+ years of relevant experience
5+ years of experience in Data analysis
5+ years of SQL experience. Ability to query & analyze data. Understand complex procedures.
5+ years of experience required in Financial Services Industry
Familiar with Financial Accounting - Balance Sheet, PnL, Cash Flows and Trial Balance
Knowledge of Derivative products, Securities Lending, and other Trading products.
Familiarity in regulatory reports (FR 2052a, NSFR, PRA110) particular to Trading products.
Understanding of Netting functionality in Derivatives & SFT’s
Experience in Project management and reporting
Strong communication skills and proficiency in explaining complex technical concepts to senior management
Demonstrated leadership
Proven interpersonal skills with ability to partner and influence across organizational lines
Proven ability of using complex analytical, interpretive and problem-solving techniques
Education:
Bachelor's degree/University degree or equivalent experience

Sander Geophysics (SGL) specializes in high-resolution airborne geophysical surveys for petroleum and mineral exploration, as well as environmental applications. The company carries out airborne gravity, magnetic, electromagnetic, and radiometric surveys, using fixed-wing aircraft and helicopters.

Title: Senior Strategy Analyst
Description:
Working knowledge of data mining and data cleansing.
Maintain an in-depth knowledge of designated markets and trends through reading reports, market research,…
Descriptions:
About Us
The Ontario Cannabis Store provides safe, responsible access to recreational cannabis for adults 19 and older. We operate the provincial online store for recreational cannabis in Ontario and are the exclusive provincial wholesaler to authorized private retail stores.

Working at the OCS is a unique opportunity to be part of an agile start-up in a ground-breaking new industry. We’re a diverse team passionate about delivering a great customer experience, working together with mutual respect, and building value out of our differences. We’re an inclusive organization that understands that delivering great results comes out of ensuring every voice is heard.

About the Role
We are recruiting for a Senior Strategy Analyst to join our Strategic Planning & Transformation team. The Senior Strategy Analyst will be responsible for conducting research, analyzing data, and developing proprietary insights, and crafting recommendations to support the strategic decision-making of the company. They will also be responsible for developing and maintaining relationships with key stakeholders. The Senior Analyst will also need to conduct analyses and drive projects with minimal supervision.
This is an exciting opportunity to utilize your extensive knowledge of strategic planning and change to help develop and shape the department mandate.

About Your Day
Execute and deliver on key market analyses including, but not limited to, growth projections and trends, supply and demand, cost curves, and economic and financial analysis and modelling.
Perform thorough, systematic analysis of key industry trends; the general social economic and political environment; legal and regulatory issues (including incentives); customers; current and potential competitors.
Translate information and analyses above into proprietary / actionable insights and sound recommendations to inform senior leadership’s strategic business decisions
Maintain an in-depth knowledge of designated markets and trends through reading reports, market research, data manipulation and financial modeling and analysis.
Drive processes for ongoing collection of data and ensure analyses of macro trends, market, customer, and competitor intelligence remain evergreen.
Maintain up-to-date knowledge of data sources, evaluating their credibility and potential utility, and leverage them across the company where appropriate.
Support the S&T team through leading a range of strategy projects, including: portfolio analysis, market landscaping and segmentation, acquisition target prioritization and strategic capability assessment
Frame, scope and analyze strategic problems and recommend best courses of action
Generate strategy collateral necessary for key decision-making activities (e.g. strategy sessions, corporate reporting, budget planning).
Undertake ad hoc projects requested by the CEO or Board.
Work with the S&T team to evaluate Where to Play and How to Play in the market
Supply the market and competitive intelligence component of strategic planning, and proactively making recommendations concerning key intelligence items that require further consideration.
Working with internal strategy network to enhance their use of strategic analysis and market and competitor intelligence.
About You
University/Bachelor’s degree in a related subject – e.g. Business, Finance, Economics, Mathematics etc.
MBA or relevant graduate degree is preferred
2-3 years of experience in strategy consulting professional services firm
2+ years working experience in Wholesaler/Distributor is an asset
Expert in Microsoft Excel (including financial modelling), PowerPoint and Word
Experience with presenting to groups, including senior leaders, with confidence and poise
Strong analytical and creative problem-solving skills
Working knowledge of data mining and data cleansing
Knowledge and understanding of programming language
Remote Work
This position offers a Hybrid work schedule. You will be required to be in the office a minimum of 1 day each week, with the ability to work from home for the remaining workdays (subject to specific business needs requiring office attendance).
When working from home, a reliable internet connection is required. Remote work is supported with cloud-based applications and collaboration tools
About the Job
City: Toronto, ON
Employment Type: Full-Time, Permanent
Required Travel: Rare, within the GTA
We are committed to providing an accessible, equitable and inclusive candidate and employee experience. We provide reasonable accommodation throughout the recruitment process and in employment. If you require an accommodation, please let us know, we will work with you to meet your needs

Title: Solution Analyst
Description: Production control activities with regards to data integration, data processing, job scheduling, setup, and background process reporting.
Descriptions:
Working as part of the ITSS Team, the Solution Analyst will complement our campus wide, service- oriented department. The Solution Analyst will be a key contributor to enterprise IT system deployment, operation, and optimization. This is a technical position, the person in it will contribute to the development and support of end user reporting and data analytics solutions. They will assist with system implementations and integrations. The Solution Analyst will work on the development of solutions that support continuous improvement, workflow management and data gathering needs. The ideal candidate will have technical skills and work experience, but recent graduates with very strong technical skills will be considered.
RESPONSIBILITIES:
Supporting operation of enterprise IT systems
Maintaining existing portfolio of reports and analytical data products along with their associated databases
Maintaining data dictionaries for the control of new and/or additional data elements
Assisting in the evolution of data management policies and procedures
Providing information that contributes to data-driven decision making by producing easy-to-understand, audience appropriate reports
Developing, documenting, and making operational, solutions based on organizational needs and standards
Collaborating with analysts, designers, end users and business process owners in the testing of solutions related to administrative systems at UPEI
Liaising with network administrators and software engineers to assist with design specifications, program logic, and data conversions
Gathering and analyzing user requirements to then design functional specifications for solutions
Production control activities with regards to data integration, data processing, job scheduling, setup, and background process reporting
Analyze business risk and recommend mitigation strategies
QUALIFICATIONS:
Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Information Systems, or Business Administration. An equivalent combination of education and work experience will be considered
Extensive experience writing SQL queries and experience with platforms like SQL Server, MySQL, etc., is required
Knowledge of enterprise-level applications, including ERP, CRM, data warehouses, etc.
Proficiency with a variety of reporting and ETL tools (e.g., Pentaho Suite, Microsoft Graph, Crystal Reports, or similar tool)
Experience in report writing and data analytics, with ability to build operationally relevant dashboards
Proficiency with one or more programming languages and web-based solution development platforms (e.g. PHP, node, Vue.js, JSF, Python, JavaScript)
Communication skills to clearly express ideas in an objective manner, and ability to adapt communication style to suit the situation and audience
Ability to develop relationships by interacting with people in a professional, respectful, and diplomatic manner
Customer service skills are required
ASSETS
These skills and experience are not required but would be considered as strong assets in a candidate:
Experience working with Microsoft enterprise platforms including Microsoft M365, Azure and/or Active Directory
Experience using Microsoft 365 applications such as Forms, Power BI, and Power Automate
Experience using Ellucian systems such as Colleague and CRM RecruiT
Experience in data classification, privacy, and security
Experience in requirements gathering and business process mapping
Experience with project management practices
Experience working in an academic institution

Title: Project Analyst: Image Guided Therapy and Healthcare Data – INOVAIT, Sunnybrook Research Institute – Full Time (02212023-1)
Description:
Guiding principles to support data sharing and data interoperability.
Reporting to INOVAIT Directors, and working collaboratively with the INOVAIT team, the…
Descriptions:
Project Analyst: Image Guided Therapy and Healthcare Data – INOVAIT, Sunnybrook Research Institute –Full Time
Position title: Project Analyst, Image Guided Therapy and Medical Data
Status and Job Option: 3 year contact (Temporary Full-time)
Hours: 37.5 hours/week
Overview
Sunnybrook Research Institute (SRI) is leading a national network at the intersection of artificial intelligence (AI) and image-guided therapy (IGT). This network, named INOVAIT, works with academic and industry stakeholders to position Canada as a sustainable source of IGT innovation and in turn economic development.
INOVAIT is seeking a highly-motivated and multi-skilled analyst to support the network’s efforts to (i) engage with our working groups to develop a strategy to facilitate the sharing of medical imaging data between organizations across Canada; (ii) perform analysis and generate data to create reports and databases on Canada’s IGT and AI landscape. For more information about the role, see below.
About INOVAIT
INOVAIT is a membership based national network with a strong industry focus that harnesses breakthroughs in IGT and the power of digital systems, enhanced analytics and AI to advance medical imaging, diagnostics and precision treatments.
INOVAIT’s mission is to help grow Canada’s IGT industry into a true global leader, by facilitating the integration of AI data handling into the most promising Canadian IGT companies and technologies, ensuring that the fundamental research is harnessed for better patient outcomes. INOVAIT will leverage Canadian expertise in image-guided therapy and artificial intelligence to build a legacy industry that will create high tech healthcare jobs, strengthen the economy, and create better health outcomes, bringing Canada to the forefront of global health technology clusters in IGT.
Job Summary
Reporting to INOVAIT Directors, and working collaboratively with the INOVAIT team, the Analyst, Image Guided Therapy and Medical Data will work with the INOVAIT team to develop the network’s Data Strategy, conduct research on data sharing and data security, write white papers on the topic of data sharing, manage the network’s Data Sharing Working Group, build and maintain an asset map of image-guided therapy-related resources and data sources in Canada, and establish and nurture relationships with key stakeholders. Success in this role is defined by the publication of best practices for the secure sharing of medical imaging data, based on research from primary and secondary sources, horizon scanning, workgroup sessions and the creation of a database of Canada’s image-guided therapy companies, academic researchers, and related resources.
Key Responsibilities
Conduct primary and secondary research on the state of medical imaging data sharing and security in institutions and companies across Canada, including conducting interviews and focus groups. Questions to be answered include:
What does “data sharing” mean to various stakeholders?
What data are currently shared and what are not? Why are organizations sharing or not sharing their data?
How are medical data being shared securely?
How can institutions be incentivized to share their medical data with companies?
What security and ethical policies must be in place to make this work and maintain public trust?
What is the legal compliance framework within Canada, its provinces and territories and how might it evolve to meet the needs of Canadians?
Develop INOVAIT’s Data Strategy using a risk-based approach, which will demonstrate how data can be leveraged to the benefit of the image-guided therapy community in Canada. The Data Strategy should include:
Organizational and technical safeguards that should be deployed to meet privacy, information security, and ethical concerns.
Participant / patient consent requirements.
Common structured data format, communications, and management standards.
Guiding principles to support data sharing and data interoperability.
Guidelines and principles regarding privacy, accessibility and security on data ownership and sovereignty.
A cyber risk guideline on how cyber risks should be assessed, mitigated and managed, including how identified risks should be monitored and/or mitigated through appropriate security controls.
With domain experts, write white papers on best practices related to imaging data sharing.
Manage the INOVAIT Data Sharing Working Group, including the convening of meetings, preparation of briefing documents, minute taking, membership curation, and project management.
Build and maintain an asset map of resources related to image-guided therapy in Canada, in particular locations and sources of imaging data.
Represent the INOVAIT Network and the INOVAIT Data Sharing Working Group internally and externally, including participation in panels, working groups, events, and conferences, delivery of presentations, and other activities as required.
Additional responsibilities upon request.
Qualifications and Skills
A master’s or doctoral degree in a discipline that is related to health information, digital data management, digital health, health management and administration, medical sciences, or biotechnology.
A high level technical understanding of medical imaging formats, databases, and data security.
An understanding of data trusts, federated learning, data governance, and related concepts.
Knowledge of the Canadian healthcare system, health system operations/management, and how medical imaging data can be used to support research and commercialization outcomes.
Experience in academic or policy research, including policy analysis.
Experience working in scientific communication, healthcare, biomedical technology, academia and/or government environments.
Excellent organizational, interpersonal, communication (written, oral), and presentation skills.
Highly developed skills in qualitative research such as interviews, questionnaires, focus groups, discourse analysis, and environmental scans.
Ability to strategically analyze and synthesize data and information to derive actionable insights and knowledge. Ability to gather, synthesize and effectively communicate information and intelligence for use by internal and external stakeholders.
Competence in MS Office Suite (Word, PowerPoint, Excel).
Competence in statistical methods and fluency in SAS and/or R an asset.
Able to work effectively in a dynamic team environment (working both independently and as part of a small team).
Certified Professional in Healthcare Information and Management Systems - Canada (CPHIMS-CA) and Certified Information Privacy Professional/Canada (CIPP/C) certifications are considered an asset.
Fluency in French is considered an asset.
How to Apply
Qualified applicants should submit their resume along with a cover letter to inovait@sunnybrook.ca. Please put “INOVAIT Analyst, Image Guided Therapy and Medical Data Position” in the subject line of your email and attach your cover letter and resume in a single pdf file named in the following format ‘<LastName>_<FirstName>_IGTMD_Application.pdf’.
We would like to thank all applicants, but only those selected for an interview will be contacted.
In accordance with Canadian Employment and Immigration guidelines, applicants must be eligible to work in Canada. Sunnybrook Research Institute is committed to providing accessible employment practices that are in compliance with the Accessibility for Ontarians with Disabilities Act (AODA). If you require accommodation for disability during any stage of the recruitment process, please indicate this in your cover letter.
Sunnybrook Research Institute is committed to providing accessible employment practices that are in compliance with the Accessibility for Ontarians with Disabilities Act (AODA). If you require accommodation for disability during any stage of the recruitment process, please indicate this in your cover letter.
Sunnybrook Research Institute is strongly committed to inclusion and diversity within its community and welcomes all applicants including but not limited to: visible minorities, all religions and ethnicities, persons with disabilities, LGBTQ persons, and all others who may contribute to the further diversification of ideas.
Please be advised that in order to be eligible for employment at Sunnybrook, all new hires must have received the full series of a COVID-19 vaccine or combination of COVID-19 vaccines approved by Health Canada (e.g., two doses of a two-dose vaccine series, or one dose of a single-dose vaccine series); AND have received the final dose of the COVID-19 vaccine at least 14 days ago. Medical exemptions or any other kind of requested exemption based upon the Hospital’s obligations pursuant to the Ontario Human Rights Code will be considered on a case-by-case basis.
